snippet: Leaving your phone plugged in when its battery is already fully charged shouldn’t be bad for it. Except that the act of charging can itself hurt our phones.
abstract: Bits blog; experts explain how frequent charging can affect smartphone battery life.

headline.main: Should You Charge Your Phone Overnight?
headline.print_headline: Should You Charge Your Phone Overnight?

snippet: Mr. Ocean has released two new albums, a music video and an art magazine that display his musical and nonmusical talents.
abstract: Jon Caramanica reviews album Blonde and 'visual album' Endless, released simultaneously by singer Frank Ocean.

headline.main: Frank Ocean Ends His Long Silence With a Variety of Works
headline.print_headline: In Many Forms, Complex Artist Ends a Silence

snippet: Google is ready to start sending out the latest version of its Android operating system to a handful of devices.

snippet: Foxconn, which assembles Apple Inc products, said on Monday two workers at its manufacturing facilities in China died last week, even as the company made efforts to improve labor conditions that came under scrutiny after a spate of suicides in rec...

snippet: Samsung Electronics Co Ltd plans to launch a program to sell refurbished used versions of its premium smartphones as early as next year, a person with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

snippet: U.S. stocks were little changed on Monday as a drop in oil prices that weighed on the energy sector was offset with a strong showing by biotech stocks.

headline.main: Wall St. Little Changed as Biotechs Offset Energy Drop

snippet: U.S. pay TV customers will have more chances this fall to catch up on shows in mid-season as networks increase video-on-demand offerings in their battle to keep audiences from jumping to streaming services.

headline.main: TV Networks Expand On-Demand Offerings to Fight 'Cord-Cutting'
headline.print_headline: TV Networks Expand On-Demand Offerings to Fight 'Cord-Cutting'

snippet: The cellphone game, popular with children and adults, has been added to a list of restrictions that New York State parolees must sign before being released.
abstract: New York State bars paroled sex offenders from internet gaming activities, including popular mobile game Pokemon Go.

headline.main: Concerns Over Rule Banning Sex Offenders From Playing Pokémon Go
headline.print_headline: In a Safeguard for Children, Some Civil Liberties Groups See Concerns

snippet: Republican Donald Trump promised Monday to be "fair, but firm" toward the estimated 11 million immigrants living in the United States illegally, a shift in tone that raised questions on whether he's backtracking from previous pledges to push for m...

headline.main: Trump Vows 'Fair, but Firm' Approach to Illegal Immigration
headline.print_headline: Trump Vows 'Fair, but Firm' Approach to Illegal Immigration

snippet: Despite banks' nudging toward online tools, many U.S. customers are not ready to give up regular visits to their nearest branch, complicating the industry's efforts to slim down.

headline.main: U.S. Banks Want to Cut Branches, but Customers Keep Coming
